page.title: 01DYMCHURCH GAZETTEER
page.content: Dymchurch Village stretches 2.7 miles along the South Eastern coast of Kent. It is protected from the English Channel by a strong stone sea wall which has been a feature of this low lying area for hundreds of years. The Eastern end of Dymchurch has a ribbon of homes close to the coast. It is backed by the fertile farm land of Romney Marsh, which is drained by an effective, attractive system of dykes, rich in animal, plant life. Beach Estate, a housing area of bungalows and two storey homes, has mainly been built since 1960. Planning permission is no longer given for bungalows. Tourism is an import source of income. The New Beach Holiday Centre with caravan and chalet accommodation attracts holiday makers who come particularly from Kent and London.
